skillTree.localised_description: Those who employ War Lion Chariots benefit considerably from the ferocity of the huge, snarling cats, keeping foes exposed to their cleaving weaponry.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
Isha's husband is the father of all Elves; his blessings are given to those who hunt for food, but woe betide those who kill for sport.
Isha's protection can protect the faithful Asur through the darkest of days.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Tree-cutter? Chayal would find your neck before you could pull that shiny toothpick from its sheath."

Korhil is the leader of the White Lions honour guard and the personal and trusted bodyguard of Phoenix King Finubar the Seafarer. Thus has Korhil served Finubar the Seafarer with unfailing loyalty for many years, and has stood steadfastly beside him at many battles. Indeed Korhil's gemstone-set belt was a gift from Finubar following the Battle of Tor Achare, where Korhil hurled himself in the path of Morech the Black's Manticore.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with High Elves, Empire and Bretonnia

Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Korhil's honest demeanour and noble bearing have won him many friends amongst the Lords of Ulthuan, and the heroes of other races besides. Korhil has ever repaid his friendship with the same loyalty he offers his liege, and gladly marches to his allies' aid should the Phoenix King consent to sparing his services.

Korhil was a famous warrior even before his rise to captain. Years before, it had been he who had hunted and slain the great lion Charandis. This was a particularly ferocious creature, mutated by the warping power of Chaos to an armour-hided brute that was mighty even by the standards of other white lions.

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment during forest battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description:
Attribute: Strider during forest battles
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: The White Lions claim Korhil to be the mightiest Elf in all of Ulthuan and certainly his strength and stature is legendary. Yet, Korhil is no lumbering giant, for he wields his long axe with dexterity and grace that makes even his fellow White Lions appear cumbersome.
Isha's husband is the father of all Elves; his blessings are given to those who hunt for food, but woe betide those who kill for sport.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -5% for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-picked by Korhil to aid in his quest, each of the Puremane Company understood the enormity of the task before them and are prepared to die in its prosecution.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +20 for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Guardians of Chrace" for White Lions of Chrace units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: War lions which have remained in service for long enough develop a true bond with their handlers.

effects.description:
Bonus vs. Infantry: +8 for Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Vigour loss reduction: -15% for Lion Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A War Lion's loyalty is to its kin, first and last. This fidelity, along with their incredible ferocity when they attack, has given rise to a great many songs and poems throughout Ulthuan, and it is with a clear measure of pride that the Phoenix King's bodyguard have adopted the famed White Lions of Chrace as their namesakes.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for War Lion units
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Causes Terror for War Lion units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Berserk" for War Lion units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

attributes.bullet_text: When this unit gets hurt it may go on a rampage against nearby enemy units, attacking the closest one and ignoring any orders given.

skillTree.localised_description: The sword is the axis of the world and its power is absolute.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"Let your name be on the lips of every man and woman; your great deeds go before you!"
In the midst of a bloodbath it's good to know that someone has your back.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can pass through trees.
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

factionEffects.localised_description: Ulthuan is besieged on all sides, but the Asur must resist like their fathers before them. While Tyrion is defending Lothern, the Phoenix King has ordered his personal and trusted bodyguard Korhil to travel to Chrace and defeat the Druchii invaders in the north. The sons of Ulthuan shall never fall!

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment during forest battles
	(all characters)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

items.colour_text: When Korhil slew the Great Lion Charandis he afterwards skinned the animal and wore it's fur proudly upon his shoulders. Years later it was remade into a magnificent cloak, enchanted by the Loremaster Finreir and presented to Korhil as a gift from Finubar himself.
The Captain of the White Lions has carried this keen-edged and finely balanced axe since the regiment's founding. Korhil is but the most recent of a long and honored line.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Korhil, Captain of the White Lions is the leader of the White Lions honor guard and the personal and trusted bodyguard of Phoenix King Finubar the Seafarer.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for White Lions of Chrace, War Lions and Lion Chariot units
